channel.title: 2 on Laurent Drouet
channel.description: Recent content in 2 on Laurent Drouet

item.title: Implications of various effort-sharing approaches for national carbon budgets and emission pathways
Looking under the hood: A comparison of techno-economic assumptions across national and global integrated assessment models
Future Global Air Quality Indices under Different Socioeconomic and Climate Assumptions
Country-level Social Cost of Carbon
item.description: Github This paper has a repository at https://country-level-scc.github.io. Online explorer In this study, we have generated the Social Cost of Carbon of all countries using different socio-economic, climatic or damage assumptions. This is a large database. So, I developed an online interactive tool to explore it. This tool is available at https://country-level-scc.github.io/explorer. The Country-level Social Cost of Carbon explorer Selection of Media Coverage Ars Technica: The US would suffer some of the biggest costs of climate change European Scientist: Country-level social cost of climate change: US and China among the countries most affected Gizmodo: Carbon Emissions Could Be Costing the US 8 Times What Trump’s EPA Estimates Grist: Psst, Trump.
